key_responsibilities: handling all non-District Office scheduling requests
managing and developing the Congresswoman’s daily schedule in concert with the District Office Scheduler/Office Manager
coordinating the Congresswoman’s official travel arrangements
ensuring follow up between the Congresswoman and the staff in the D.C. and District offices
requirements: able to problem-solve in a fast-paced work environment

office: Republican staff of the Committee on House Administration
key_responsibilities: assist the senior counsel with parliamentary and legislative matters under the Committee’s jurisdiction including election and campaign finance legislation, contested elections, and administrative legal issues

requirements: bachelor’s degree with at least 4 years of legislative experience on the Hill
working as part of a team
strong skills in written and oral communication
ability to work effectively under tight deadline
several years of experience in federal budgeting
background in federal health care policy
a master’s degree in public policy or related field

key_responsibilities: manage all aspects of constituent correspondence
work with the scheduler to coordinate Member’s schedule in the Washington office
tracking and assigning mail through constituent management software
preparing letters of greetings, condolence and congratulations on behalf of the Member
post office problems and requests for expedited passports
recruiting training, scheduling and assigning duties
requirements: significant experience interacting with the public
a working knowledge of the District of Columbia
resident of the District of Columbia or willing to move immediately to D.C.
salary: based on skill and experience level
